result.execSummary:
The disposition of "Other" is used to indicate several different dispositions. The Charge(s)/Sentence(s) and Court Record Events sections of the WCCA record display additional information that must be reviewed in order to determine the exact disposition of the charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Ernie Farmer in court with Attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Police Officer telephoned the court to advise he is available for testimony.

State informs Court that essential witnesses have not appeared in court for today's scheduled trial, therefore they are not prepared to proceed to trial.
Defense counsel motion to dismiss.
Court orders case dismissed without prejudice.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

ADDRESS INFO for Eric Ernie Farmer Jr.
Current: 8125 West Center Street   Apt. 4, Milwaukee, WI   (Effective: 01-07-2015)
Prior: 3167 North 45th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated January 12, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail received and filed.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  State unable to proceed to trial.  Court grants State's request for an adjourment.  Bail motion heard.  Court modifies bail to $2,500.00 signature bond, TOT Justice Point for supervision with same conditions of release, including no contact with victims listed on the no contact order.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
From defendant received and filed.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant now wants a Speedy Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney needs to talk with ADA Carmody.  Matter rescheduled for a plea.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion for Reduction of Bail submitted by defendant received and filed.  Copy of Motion sent to defendant's attorney, Jeff Wilson and State

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Parties request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter and motion for reduction of bail by the DEFENDANT received and filed. Defense counsel notified.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF A PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA IN BRANCH 21.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court. Defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court in bull pen, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.  The currently scheduled date for plea/sentencing of 7/20/15 has been rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond, received and filed.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

*represented by counsel*

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Eric Ernie Farmer not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail/bond Hearing and Scheduling conference.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  State awaiting additional discovery (video) to turn over to defense; status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond, received and filed.

Defendant Eric Ernie Farmer in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Eric Ernie Farmer in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jermain F. or Co-Defendant Darion Davis

Defendant Eric Ernie Farmer in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Eric Ernie Farmer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
